newsitem.title: FRANCE: WP3 to meet in Paris on Wednesday.
newsitem.headline: WP3 to meet in Paris on Wednesday.

text.p: Finance ministry and central bank officials from 10 major powers, comprising the group known as the Working Party 3, will meet in Paris on Wednesday, the OECD said on Tuesday.
A spokeswoman for the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) said the group would be chaired by Deputy U.S. Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers.
She said the officials would discuss the economic situation of the world's economies at the meeting.
She refused to confirm reports that the meeting would discuss the sale of a small part of the International Monetary Fund's gold reserves to finance debt relief for the world's poorest nations.
Germany remains firmly opposed to such sales while most other nations are agreed.
The 10 majors powers, known as the G10, are actually 11 nations comprising Britain, Belgium, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the Netherlands, Sweden, Switzerland and the United States.
